articles.title: U.S., Israel sign joint pledge to deny Iran nuclear weaponry
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Yair Lapid signed a joint pledge on Thursday to deny Iran nuclear arms, a show of unity by allies long divided over diplomacy with Tehran.
articles.content: JERUSALEM, July 14 (Reuters) - U.S. President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Yair Lapid signed a joint pledge on Thursday to deny Iran nuclear arms, a show of unity by allies long divided over … [+4490 chars]

articles.author: Iqbal Athas and Rhea Mogul, CNN
articles.title: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa leaves Maldives for Singapore
articles.description: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has fled Maldives on board a flight for Singapore, a high-ranking security source in Colombo told CNN, as anger grows in his home country over his refusal to formally resign.

articles.title: Bill Gates vows to drop off world's rich list
articles.description: The Microsoft co-founder says he will move a further $20bn into his philanthropic foundation.
articles.content:
By Daniel ThomasBusiness reporter, BBC News

articles.title: Dozens Unaccounted for After Storms Drench Southwest Virginia

articles.author: Chuck Johnston, CNN
articles.title: A man was charged in the rape of a 10-year-old who traveled to Indiana for an abortion
articles.description: A Columbus man has been charged with raping a 10-year-old Ohio girl who then had to travel to Indiana seeking an abortion after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, according to court proceedings CNN obtained through affiliate WBNS.

articles.title: Uvalde video raises more calls for police accountability
articles.description: UVALDE, Texas (AP) — As video taken inside Robb Elementary School  puts in full view the bewildering inaction by law enforcement during the May slaughter of 19 children and two teachers, some in Uvalde are shouting: Will police face consequences?
